importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when President Trump announced plans to meet with Vladimir Putin in Budapest to discuss the war in Ukraine, following a two-and-a-half-hour phone call.

The date of the scheduled meeting between US President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in the Oval Office, where they will discuss the Trump-Putin call and potential military aid, including Tomahawk cruise missiles.

importantTimeframes.approximateTimeFrameStart: after the phone call on October 16, 2025
importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: Trump stated he would meet Putin 'within two weeks or so' following their phone call, indicating a timeline for diplomatic efforts to end the war in Ukraine.
Secretary of State Marco Rubio is set to meet with Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov 'very shortly' to negotiate a meeting location, showing rapid follow-up actions.

keyTakeAways: President Donald Trump announced plans to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Budapest, Hungary, to discuss ending the war in Ukraine, following a productive two-and-a-half-hour phone call.
The call, requested by Russia, was described as 'very productive' by Trump and 'highly informative and extremely frank' by a Kremlin aide.
Hungary, led by Prime Minister Viktor Orban, supports the summit and has maintained a close relationship with both Putin and Trump.
Trump and Putin discussed peace in the Middle East, trade relations post-war, and the potential supply of Tomahawk cruise missiles to Ukraine.

Putin expressed concern that supplying Tomahawks would damage bilateral relations and hinder peace, while Trump acknowledged this concern and noted that he would take Putin's views into account during talks with Zelensky.

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky expressed optimism that the momentum in the Middle East could influence peace negotiations and noted that Russian officials are now rushing to resume dialogue in response to the Tomahawk discussion.
Secretary of State Marco Rubio will lead a delegation to meet with Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov, with a meeting time and location to be set soon.
Trump declined to support immediate sanctions legislation against Russia, suggesting that diplomacy may be more effective than punitive measures at this time.
The meeting in Budapest comes more than two months after Trumpâ€™s last in-person summit with Putin in Anchorage, Alaska, and Budapest was previously considered a potential site for such a meeting.

namedEntities.name: Donald Trump
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is central to the article as the initiator and main figure in planning a summit with Vladimir Putin to end the war in Ukraine.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Putin
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the counterpart to Trump in the proposed summit, with both leaders discussing peace, trade, and military strategy in the context of the Ukraine war.

namedEntities.name: Volodymyr Zelensky
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is scheduled to meet Trump separately to discuss air defense, missile capabilities, and the potential impact of Tomahawk missiles on peace negotiations.

namedEntities.name: Hungary
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hungary is the proposed location of the Trump-Putin summit in Budapest, and its leadership, especially Prime Minister Viktor Orban, supports and promotes the peace initiative.

namedEntities.name: Viktor Orban
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He actively supports the peace summit, has a close relationship with both Putin and Trump, and publicly declared Hungary as the 'island of peace'.

namedEntities.name: Marco Rubio
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is leading a delegation to meet with Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov to set up future diplomatic contact between the U.S. and Russia.

namedEntities.name: Sergey Lavrov
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is scheduled to meet with Marco Rubio to coordinate the logistics and timing of future diplomatic engagements between the U.S. and Russia.

namedEntities.name: Melania Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: First Lady of the United States
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She advocated for Ukrainian children's reunification with families, and Putin praised her efforts during the call, highlighting her diplomatic role in humanitarian issues.

namedEntities.name: Tomahawk cruise missiles
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is a key topic of discussion between Trump and Zelensky, with both sides expressing concerns about their use and impact on peace negotiations.

namedEntities.name: Middle East peace
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Trump cited success in the Middle East as a model for ending the Ukraine war, suggesting that regional peace achievements may influence diplomatic outcomes in Europe.

summaryOfNewsArticle: U.S. President Donald Trump announced plans to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Budapest, Hungary, to discuss ending the war in Ukraine, following a two-and-a-half-hour phone call described as 'very productive' by both sides. The meeting is expected within two weeks, with Secretary of State Marco Rubio set to meet with Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov to finalize logistics. Trump and Putin discussed peace in the Middle East, trade post-war, and the potential supply of Tomahawk cruise missiles to Ukraine, with Putin warning that such supplies could damage relations and hinder peace. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky will meet Trump the next day to discuss air defense and missile capabilities, and he sees the momentum from Middle Eastern peace as a key factor in ending the war. Hungary, led by Prime Minister Viktor Orban, supports the summit and has a longstanding relationship with both Russian and American leadership. The article highlights the shifting diplomatic tone from sanctions to diplomacy, with Trump emphasizing peace over punitive action.
title: Trump says he will meet with Putin in Budapest to discuss war in Ukraine
